title: Procedure-Based Scientific Manual Design: Integrated Theory and Practice Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific terminology and ability to use digital devices
context.additional_context: Science experiment procedure manual development project for general citizens

learning_goals: Learners can design a science experiment manual by applying its four components: goals, prerequisites, undesirable states, and actions/responses.
Learners can apply procedure design guidelines based on theoretical frameworks to real project scenarios.
Learners can systematically write and evaluate procedures for three types of science experiments (e.g., chemical reactions, ecological observations, physics experiments) by team.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
